page.title: 04Landscape: FINTRY. General
page.content:
Introduction. See also: north { Landscape}west east:{FINTRY south
The Fintry area is extremely{rich in {landforms}of various types.
{Geologically}there are two distinct areas. The hills are made of{igneous} rocks, principally{lava and tuff.}The lowland is composed of{sedimentary} rocks of the{Old Red Sandstone}period.
{Glaciation}played an important role in shaping the land with many excellent { {erosional and depositional features.}
The{River Endrick}has created a wide floodplain, parts of which frequently flood during winter. Again there are many examples of{river features.
